Unsourced material may be challenged and removed. *Find sources:* "Serangoon" – news **·** newspapers **·** books **·** scholar **·** JSTOR *(April 2012)* *(Learn how and when to remove this message)*Planning Area and HDB Town in North-East Region, Singapore **Serangoon** ([IPA](/wiki/International_Phonetic_Alphabet): /səˈræŋɡuːn/ *sə-RANG-goon*) is a [planning area](/wiki/Planning_Areas_of_Singapore) and [residential town](/wiki/New_towns_of_Singapore) located in the [North-East Region of Singapore](/wiki/North-East_Region,_Singapore). Serangoon is bordered by these planning areas – [Sengkang](/wiki/Sengkang) to the north, [Hougang](/wiki/Hougang) to the east, [Ang Mo Kio](/wiki/Ang_Mo_Kio) and [Bishan](/wiki/Bishan,_Singapore) to the west, as well as [Toa Payoh](/wiki/Toa_Payoh) to the south. Serangoon planning area has a total of seven subzones: Serangoon Central, [Lorong Chuan](/wiki/Lorong_Chuan), Upper Paya Lebar, [Serangoon Garden](/wiki/Serangoon_Garden), [Serangoon North](/wiki/Serangoon_North), Seletar Hills and Serangoon North Industrial Estate. ## Transportation The original Serangoon bus interchange was opened on 13 March 1988 along Serangoon Central. It later relocated to [nex](/wiki/Nex,_Singapore) on 3 September 2011. ### Rail network A large part of the [North East MRT line](/wiki/North_East_Line) runs in parallel with this arterial road. Stations that are located along this road are from [Little India](/wiki/Little_India_MRT_station) to [Kovan](/wiki/Kovan_MRT_station). Current MRT Stations that are located in the Serangoon area include: - **NE12** **CC13** [Serangoon](/wiki/Serangoon_MRT_station) - **CC14** [Lorong Chuan](/wiki/Lorong_Chuan_MRT_station) There are plans to build two more stations as part of the [Cross Island MRT line](/wiki/Cross_Island_Line), slated to be completed by 2030. The stations are as follows: - **CR09** [Serangoon North](/wiki/Serangoon_North_MRT_station) - **CR10** [Tavistock](/wiki/Tavistock_MRT_station) ### Road network Upper Serangoon Road is an important road being one of the oldest and busiest roads, links the North-East region with Central area Other important main roads include Yio Chu Kang Road, Upper Paya Lebar Road, Bartley Road, Braddell Road, and Ang Mo Kio Avenue 1 and 3. The CTE [(Central Expressway)](/wiki/Central_Expressway,_Singapore) at the west of the town provides a link to [Seletar Airport](/wiki/Seletar_Airport), Toa Payoh and CBD (Central Business District). ## Education As of 2017[update], this area has a total of 5 primary schools, 4 secondary schools and [Nanyang Junior College](/wiki/Nanyang_Junior_College). ## Politics Serangoon Neighbourhood 1, some parts of Neighbourhood 2 and [Serangoon Garden](/wiki/Serangoon_Garden) fall under the [Aljunied GRC](/wiki/Aljunied_GRC) (Serangoon division), served by the [Workers' Party](/wiki/Workers%27_Party_(Singapore)), while the area surrounding Upper Paya Lebar Road lies within the Paya Lebar division. Prior to 2006, the Serangoon division belonged to the [Marine Parade GRC](/wiki/Marine_Parade_GRC), which administers Serangoon Neighbourhoods 2, 3 and 4 in the Braddell Heights division till this day. Neighbourhood 5 in [Serangoon North](/wiki/Serangoon_North) falls under the [Ang Mo Kio GRC](/wiki/Ang_Mo_Kio_GRC) (Seletar–Serangoon division). - [Serangoon North](/wiki/Serangoon_North) - [Serangoon Garden](/wiki/Serangoon_Garden) - [Nex](/wiki/Nex,_Singapore) ## Gallery ## Sources - Victor R Savage, Brenda S A Yeoh (2003), *Toponymics – A Study of Singapore Street Names*, Eastern Universities Press, [ISBN](/wiki/ISBN_(identifier)) 981-210-205-1 - Masterplan 2003 Archived 16 July 2012 at the [Wayback Machine](/wiki/Wayback_Machine) – [Urban Redevelopment Authority](/wiki/Urban_Redevelopment_Authority) - Serangoon Planning Report 1995 Archived 27 September 2007 at the [Wayback Machine](/wiki/Wayback_Machine)
